00028 //=============================================================================
00029 //
00030 //   Inline assembly implementations of the commonly used string functions
00031 //   These will work only on i386 based machines and can be compiled
00032 //   only by gcc
00033 //
00034 //=============================================================================
00035 
00036 extern inline bool kvi_strEqualCS(const char * pcStr1, const char * pcStr2)
00037 {
00038         // An instruction pattern is really useful in this case.
00039         // When inlining, GCC can optimize to load esi and edi
00040         // directly with the strings , without pushing and getting it
00041         // from the stack...
00042         register bool bEax;
00043         __asm__ __volatile__ (
00044                 "       cld\n"
00045                 "1:\n"
00046                 "       lodsb %%ds:(%%esi),%%al\n"
00047                 "       scasb %%es:(%%edi),%%al\n"
00048                 "       jne 2f\n"
00049                 "       testb %%al,%%al\n"
00050                 "       jne 1b\n"
00051                 "       movl $0x1,%%eax\n"
00052                 "       jmp 3f\n"
00053                 "2:\n"
00054                 "       xorl %%eax,%%eax\n"
00055                 "3:"
00056                 : "=a" (bEax), "=&S" (pcStr1), "=&D" (pcStr2)
00057                 :             "1"   (pcStr1), "2"   (pcStr2)
00058         );
00059         return bEax;
00060 }
00061 
00062 extern inline bool kvi_strEqualCSN(const char * pcStr1, const char * pcStr2, int iLen)
00063 {
00064         register bool bEax;
00065         __asm__ __volatile__ (
00066                 "1:\n"
00067                 "       decl %3\n"
00068                 "       js 2f\n"
00069                 "       movb (%1),%%al\n"
00070                 "       incl %1\n"
00071                 "       cmpb %%al,(%2)\n"
00072                 "       jne 3f\n"
00073                 "       incl %2\n"
00074                 "       testb %%al,%%al\n"
00075                 "       jne 1b\n"
00076                 "2:\n"
00077                 "       movl $0x1,%%eax\n"
00078                 "       jmp 4f\n"
00079                 "3:\n"
00080                 "       xorl %%eax,%%eax\n"
00081                 "4:\n"
00082                 : "=a" (bEax),  "=r" (pcStr1), "=r" (pcStr2), "=r" (iLen)
00083                 :              "1"  (pcStr1), "2"  (pcStr2), "3"  (iLen)
00084         );
00085         return bEax;
00086 }
00087 
00088 // OPTIMIZATION
00089 // The following two functions are used to compare a variable string with one in that
00090 // only A-Z<->a-z case insensivity is significant.
00091 // For example
00092 // kvi_strEqualNoLocalCI("a string that does not contain any strange char",str2)
00093 // will always give the correct result
00094 // These will NOT work with localizable characters:
00095 // 'a' with umlaut will be not equal to 'A' with umlaut
00096 
00097 extern inline bool kvi_strEqualNoLocaleCI(const char * pcStr1, const char * pcStr2)
00098 {
00099         // Trivial implementation
00100         // Ignores completely locales....only A-Z chars are transformed to a-z
00101         // Anyway...it will work for IRC :)
00102         register int iReg;
00103         register bool bEax;
00104         __asm__ __volatile__ (
00105                 "1:\n"
00106                 "       movb (%2),%%al\n"
00107                 "       cmpb $65,%%al\n"
00108                 "       jb 2f\n"
00109                 "       cmpb $90,%%al\n"
00110                 "       ja 2f\n"
00111                 "       addb $32,%%al\n"
00112                 "2:\n"
00113                 "       movb (%3),%b1\n"
00114                 "       cmpb $65,%b1\n"
00115                 "       jb 3f\n"
00116                 "       cmpb $90,%b1\n"
00117                 "       ja 3f\n"
00118                 "       addb $32,%b1\n"
00119                 "3:\n"
00120                 "       cmpb %%al,%b1\n"
00121                 "       jne 4f\n"
00122                 "       incl %2\n"
00123                 "       incl %3\n"
00124                 "       testb %%al,%%al\n"
00125                 "       jne 1b\n"
00126                 "       movl $1,%%eax\n"
00127                 "       jmp 5f\n"
00128                 "4:\n"
00129                 "       xorl %%eax,%%eax\n"
00130                 "5:\n"
00131                 : "=a" (bEax), "=q" (iReg), "=r" (pcStr1), "=r" (pcStr2)
00132                 :                         "2"  (pcStr1), "3"  (pcStr2)
00133         );
00134         return bEax;
00135 }
00136 
00137 extern inline bool kvi_strEqualNoLocaleCIN(const char * pcStr1, const char * pcStr2, int iLen)
00138 {
00139 
00140         register int iReg;
00141         register bool bEax;
00142         __asm__ __volatile__ (
00143                 "1:\n"
00144                 "       decl %4\n"
00145                 "       js 4f\n"
00146                 "       movb (%2),%%al\n"
00147                 "       cmpb $65,%%al\n"
00148                 "       jb 2f\n"
00149                 "       cmpb $90,%%al\n"
00150                 "       ja 2f\n"
00151                 "       addb $32,%%al\n"
00152                 "2:\n"
00153                 "       movb (%3),%b1\n"
00154                 "       cmpb $65,%b1\n"
00155                 "       jb 3f\n"
00156                 "       cmpb $90,%b1\n"
00157                 "       ja 3f\n"
00158                 "       addb $32,%b1\n"
00159                 "3:\n"
00160                 "       cmpb %%al,%b1\n"
00161                 "       jne 5f\n"
00162                 "       incl %2\n"
00163                 "       incl %3\n"
00164                 "       testb %%al,%%al\n"
00165                 "       jne 1b\n"
00166                 "4:\n"
00167                 "       movl $1,%%eax\n"
00168                 "       jmp 6f\n"
00169                 "5:\n"
00170                 "       xorl %%eax,%%eax\n"
00171                 "6:\n"
00172                 : "=a" (bEax), "=q" (iReg), "=r" (pcStr1), "=r" (pcStr2), "=r" (iLen)
00173                 :                         "2"  (pcStr1), "3"  (pcStr2), "4"  (iLen)
00174         );
00175         return bEax;
00176 }
00177 
00178 
00179 extern inline int kvi_strLen(const char * pcStr)
00180 {
00181         register int iEcx;
00182         __asm__ __volatile__(
00183                 "       cld\n"
00184                 "       repne\n"
00185                 "       scasb\n"
00186                 "       notl %0\n"
00187                 "       decl %0"
00188                 : "=c" (iEcx),        "=&D" (pcStr)
00189                 : "0"  (0xffffffff), "1"   (pcStr), "a" (0)
00190         );
00191         return iEcx;
00192 }
